intro: Satureja montana subsp. variegata, commonly known as variegated mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that display a striking variegation of green and white or yellow. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in summer, which are clustered in terminal spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. This subspecies is valued for its medicinal properties and use in culinary applications.
